conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by four objects labeled A, B, C, and D.
A is a dark spherical object.
B is a blue cylindrical object with mechanical parts.
C is a round pastry with red toppings.
D is a rectangular sandwich or similar food item.
Shadows are cast on textured ground, possibly concrete or stone.
Light source position affects shadow direction and size.
Shadows are cast away from the light source.
Shadow formation occurs when objects block light rays.
Shadow size and position depend on light source position relative to objects.
Moving light source closer generally enlarges shadows.
Moving light source farther away generally reduces shadow size.
Changing light source angle alters shadow direction and length.
Light source moving forward and above means moving away and higher.
Shadows should become smaller as light source moves away and higher.
